syllabus_leaves.path: Salient Features of the Constitution-I > Fundamental Rights > Limitations > (i) Emergency: Article-19 can be suspended during Emergency.
path_titles: (i) Emergency: Article-19 can be suspended during Emergency.
syllabus_leaves.title: (i) Emergency: Article-19 can be suspended during Emergency.

syllabus_leaves.path: Salient Features of the Constitution-I > Fundamental Rights > Limitations > (ii) Not Absolute: The security of the State and national interest being of paramount interest, reasonable restrictions could be imposed on the implementation of this right.
path_titles: (ii) Not Absolute: The security of the State and national interest being of paramount interest, reasonable restrictions could be imposed on the implementation of this right.
syllabus_leaves.title: (ii) Not Absolute: The security of the State and national interest being of paramount interest, reasonable restrictions could be imposed on the implementation of this right.

syllabus_leaves.path: Salient Features of the Constitution-I > Fundamental Rights > Limitations > (iii) Laws of Parliament: Legislations like Preventive Detention; Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA, a law to ensure the delivery of essential services like public transport, health services, etc., which if obstructed would affect the normal life of the people) impose certain restrictions on the Right to Freedom.
path_titles: (iii) Laws of Parliament: Legislations like Preventive Detention; Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA, a law to ensure the delivery of essential services like public transport, health services, etc., which if obstructed would affect the normal life of the people) impose certain restrictions on the Right to Freedom.
syllabus_leaves.title: (iii) Laws of Parliament: Legislations like Preventive Detention; Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA, a law to ensure the delivery of essential services like public transport, health services, etc., which if obstructed would affect the normal life of the people) impose certain restrictions on the Right to Freedom.

syllabus_leaves.path: Salient Features of the Constitution-I > Fundamental Rights > Limitations > (b) Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences: Under Article-20 the following protections are available to a citizen: > (i) Against greater penalty than what is prescribed under the law is prohibited.
path_titles: (b) Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences: Under Article-20 the following protections are available to a citizen:
(i) Against greater penalty than what is prescribed under the law is prohibited.
syllabus_leaves.title: (i) Against greater penalty than what is prescribed under the law is prohibited.

syllabus_leaves.path: Salient Features of the Constitution-I > Fundamental Rights > Limitations > (b) Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences: Under Article-20 the following protections are available to a citizen: > (ii) No one can be punished or prosecuted for the same offence twice.
path_titles: (b) Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences: Under Article-20 the following protections are available to a citizen:
(ii) No one can be punished or prosecuted for the same offence twice.
syllabus_leaves.title: (ii) No one can be punished or prosecuted for the same offence twice.

syllabus_leaves.path: Salient Features of the Constitution-I > Fundamental Rights > Limitations > (b) Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences: Under Article-20 the following protections are available to a citizen: > (iii) A person cannot be compelled to be a witness in the case where he himself is accused of the offence.
path_titles: (b) Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences: Under Article-20 the following protections are available to a citizen:
(iii) A person cannot be compelled to be a witness in the case where he himself is accused of the offence.
syllabus_leaves.title: (iii) A person cannot be compelled to be a witness in the case where he himself is accused of the offence.
